WorkItem.ClosedComment: Closing for failure to communicate and provide requested files
WorkItem.Description: I'm still noticing huge discrepancies with HP in Rawr and in-game.  Even with a naked model, it's not matching what I have in game naked.  The base value seems to be off be a couple of hundred, and only gets worse as you add gear and buffs.

Comments.Message: Can you supply say a picture in game of your stat panel naked and untalented and out-of-shape. Showing what the base stat is could help. I know from a Night Elf perspective health does seem to line up fairly well. So it could be a base stat issue.

Forgot to mention, first of all check to make sure your target level is set to 80 instead of 83. Stats will become lower then they show in game because the program displays what your stats will be against a raid boss level mob.

I can supply the stats for an untalented, ungeared tauren who has Rank 6 Toughness.  I'll get that when I get home.  If Toughness is a problem, I'll try to find someone in guild who doesn't have it (*really* don't feel like dropping it and releveling mining.)

Also, changing the target mob level has no effect on the HP that Rawr is showing me.
Toughness we can work around since we can just subtract 60 stamina from the total. So just post a pic of your in-game stats in caster form. then one again in bear form.
Also post your RAWR file as well. in case there is an issue with your file itself.
